intro: Hieracium recensitum, commonly known as the recent flowering hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and serrated. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, producing yellow-orange inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium recensitum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
